il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.method_call

Class MethodCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.method_call.MethodCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MethodCall
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents the interface method + arguments. Refers to NliEntity ids as defined by some state, but does not contain a field referring to that state. When invoking the MethodCall the caller provides the state (which may be a deep-copy).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createValidFunctionCall

        @Nullable
public static MethodCall createValidFunctionCall(MethodId methodId,
                                                            java.lang.String entityIdOfObjectMethodIsInvokeOn,
                                                            java.util.ArrayList<Argument> arguments,
                                                            State initialState)
        Parameters:
        initialState - only used in order to verify the validity of types, not referred to by the returned object.
        Returns:
        null in a valid function call can not be created because any of the following: - wrong size of 'arguments'. - invalid type of the entity to invoke the method on - invalid entities in the arguments: - invalid type. - not a single entity when a single value is expected.

      • invokeOnDeepCopyOfState

        @Nullable
public State invokeOnDeepCopyOfState(State state)
        Invokes this function call on the root entity of a new deep copy of 'state'. Also calls method.setAccessible(true).
        Returns:
        On success: the new copy of the state after the execution of the SI function with it. null is returned if the invocation failed, meaning that the invoked interface function threw some Throwable. We expect this to happen often during inference. When this happen, assume the state is corrupted.

      • getArguments

        public java.util.ArrayList<Argument> getArguments()
